intro: Euodia gjellerupii, commonly known as the Gjellerup euodia, is a small evergreen shrub native to the island of Saba in the Caribbean. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically yellow or orange when mature. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
